verses.verse: My brothers, <WG80> have <WG2192> not the faith <WG4102> of our Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424> Christ, <WG5547> the Lord of glory, <WG1391> with respect <WG4382> of persons. <WG4382>

For if <WG1437> there come <WG1525> to your <WG5216> assembly <WG4864> a man <WG435> with a gold <WG5554> ring, <WG5554> in goodly <WG2986> apparel, <WG2066> and there come <WG1525> in also <WG2532> a poor <WG4434> man in vile <WG4508> raiment; <WG2066>

And you have respect <WG1914> to him that wears <WG5409> the gay <WG2986> clothing, <WG2066> and say <WG2036> to him, Sit <WG2521> you here <WG5602> in a good <WG2573> place; and say <WG2036> to the poor, <WG4434> Stand <WG2476> you there, <WG1563> or <WG2228> sit <WG2521> here <WG5602> under <WG5259> my footstool: <WG5286>
Are you not then <WG2532> partial <WG1252> in yourselves, <WG1438> and are become <WG1096> judges <WG2923> of evil <WG4190> thoughts? <WG1261>

Listen, <WG191> my beloved <WG27> brothers, <WG80> Has not God <WG2316> chosen <WG1586> the poor <WG4434> of this <WG5127> world <WG2889> rich <WG4145> in faith, <WG4102> and heirs <WG2818> of the kingdom <WG932> which <WG3739> he has promised <WG1861> to them that love <WG25> him?
But you have despised <WG818> the poor. <WG4434> Do not rich <WG4145> men oppress <WG2616> you, and draw <WG1670> you before <WG1519> the judgment <WG2922> seats?
Do not they blaspheme <WG987> that worthy <WG2570> name <WG3686> by the which <WG3588> you are called? <WG1941>

If <WG1487> you fulfill <WG5055> the royal <WG937> law <WG3551> according <WG2596> to the scripture, <WG1124> You shall love <WG25> your neighbor <WG4139> as yourself, <WG4572> you do <WG4160> well: <WG2573>
But if <WG1487> you have respect <WG4380> to persons, <WG4380> you commit <WG2038> sin, <WG266> and are convinced <WG1651> of the law <WG3551> as transgressors. <WG3848>
For whoever <WG3748> shall keep <WG5083> the whole <WG3650> law, <WG3551> and yet offend <WG4417> in one <WG1520> point, he is guilty <WG1777> of all. <WG3956>

For he that said, <WG2036> Do not commit <WG3431> adultery, <WG3431> said <WG2036> also, <WG2532> Do not kill. <WG5407> Now <WG1161> if <WG1487> you commit <WG3431> no <WG3756> adultery, <WG3431> yet <WG1161> if you kill, <WG5407> you are become <WG1096> a transgressor <WG3848> of the law. <WG3551>
So <WG3779> speak <WG2980> you, and so <WG3779> do, <WG4160> as they that shall be judged <WG2919> by the law <WG3551> of liberty. <WG1657>
For he shall have judgment <WG2920> without <WG448> mercy, <WG448> that has showed <WG4160> no <WG3361> mercy; <WG1656> and mercy <WG1656> rejoices <WG2620> against <WG2620> judgment. <WG2920>

What <WG5101> does it profit, <WG3786> my brothers, <WG80> though <WG1437> a man <WG5100> say <WG3004> he has <WG2192> faith, <WG4102> and have <WG2192> not works? <WG2041> can <WG1410> faith <WG4102> save <WG4982> him?
If <WG1437> a brother <WG80> or <WG2228> sister <WG79> be naked, <WG1131> and destitute <WG3007> of daily <WG2184> food, <WG5160>

And one <WG5100> of you say <WG2036> to them, Depart <WG5217> in peace, <WG1515> be you warmed <WG2328> and filled; <WG5526> notwithstanding you give <WG1325> them not those <WG3588> things which are needful <WG2006> to the body; <WG4983> what <WG5101> does it profit? <WG3786>
Even <WG2532> so <WG3779> faith, <WG4102> if <WG1437> it has <WG2192> not works, <WG2041> is dead, <WG3498> being alone. <WG2596> <WG1438>

Yes, <WG235> a man <WG5100> may say, <WG2046> You have <WG2192> faith, <WG4102> and I have works: <WG2041> show <WG1166> me your faith <WG4102> without <WG5565> your works, <WG2041> and I will show <WG1166> you my faith <WG4102> by my works. <WG2041>
You believe <WG4100> that there is one <WG1520> God; <WG2316> you do <WG4160> well: <WG2573> the devils <WG1140> also <WG2532> believe, <WG4100> and tremble. <WG5425>
But will <WG2309> you know, <WG1097> O vain <WG2756> man, <WG444> that faith <WG4102> without <WG5565> works <WG2041> is dead? <WG3498>
Was not Abraham <WG11> our father <WG3962> justified <WG1344> by works, <WG2041> when he had offered <WG399> Isaac <WG2464> his son <WG5207> on the altar? <WG2379>
See <WG991> you how <WG3754> faith <WG4102> worked <WG4903> with his works, <WG2041> and by works <WG2041> was faith <WG4102> made <WG5048> perfect? <WG5048>

And the scripture <WG1124> was fulfilled <WG4137> which <WG3588> said, <WG3004> Abraham <WG11> believed <WG4100> God, <WG2316> and it was imputed <WG3049> to him for righteousness: <WG1343> and he was called <WG2564> the Friend <WG5384> of God. <WG2316>
You see <WG3708> then <WG5106> how that by works <WG2041> a man <WG444> is justified, <WG1344> and not by faith <WG4102> only. <WG3440>

Likewise <WG3668> also <WG2532> was not Rahab <WG4460> the harlot <WG4204> justified <WG1344> by works, <WG2041> when she had received <WG5264> the messengers, <WG32> and had sent <WG1524> them out another <WG2087> way? <WG3598>
For as the body <WG4983> without <WG5565> the spirit <WG4151> is dead, <WG3498> so <WG3779> faith <WG4102> without <WG5565> works <WG2041> is dead <WG3498> also. <WG2532>
